document.docAuthor: Prathapan, K. D. & Shameem, K. M.
document.docTitle: Wallacea jarawa Prathapan & Shameem 2017, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Wallacea Baly (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Cassidinae: Bothryonopini) infesting coconut palm in the Indian Ocean Islands of Andaman & Nicobar

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Wallacea Baly (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Cassidinae: Bothryonopini) infesting coconut palm in the Indian Ocean Islands of Andaman & Nicobar

Description of adult. LENgTh (N=6) 4.13–5.46 MM, WidTh (N=6) 1.51–2.02 MM. [ MALE (N=3): LENgTh 4.13–4.98 MM; WidTh 1.52–1.80; FEMALE (N=3): LENgTh 4.68–5.46 MM; WidTh 1.73–2.02 MM].

HEAd: VERTEX PUNCTATE, SizE Of PUNCTURES NO MORE ThAN hALf Of LARgER PUNCTURES ON PRONOTUM. STRidULATORY fiLE REAChiNg NEARLY UP TO POST CALLiNAL TRANSVERSE dEPRESSiON. MidfRONTAL SULCUS, MidCRANiAL SUTURE diSTiNCT, NOT dEEP. POST CALLiNAL TRANSVERSE dEPRESSiON PRESENT. MAXiLLARY PALPOMERES 2–4 EACh LONgER ThAN PRECEdiNg ONE; LAST PALPOMERE AbOUT TWiCE AS LONg AS SECONd. LAST LAbiAL PALPOMERE SUbEqUAL TO fiRST ANd SECONd COMbiNEd.

ANTENNA: 0.41–0.46 TiMES AS LONg AS bOdY. FOUR PROXiMAL ANTENNOMERES ShiNY, REST dARKER WiTh ShORT, ThiCKLY SET SETAE. ANTENNOMERES I–IV WiTh ShALLOW CiRCULAR ANd ELONgATE PiTS, SETAE ShORT ANd SPARSE. ANTENNOMERES ROUNd iN CROSS SECTiON, EXCEPT APEX Of LAST NEARLY fLAT. PROPORTiONATE LENgTh Of ANTENNOMERES I–XI: 1: 0.65–0.78: 0.76– 0.88: 0.59–0.75: 0.78–1.00: 0.79–0.94: 0.79–0.87: 0.70–0.85: 0.73–0.85: 0.79–0.86: 1.12–1.31.

PRONOTUM 1.15–1.21 TiMES WidER ThAN LONg. DiSC CONVEX ANTEROMEdiALLY, WiTh A dEPRESSiON iN fRONT Of SCUTELLUM, LATERALLY RAThER fLAT OR SLighTLY dEPRESSEd. PUNCTURES ON diSC SMALL TO LARgE, iNTERSTiCES bETWEEN PUNCTURES VERY MiNUTELY PUNCTATE; A NARROW STRiP ALONg MiddLE Of diSC iMPUNCTATE; ON EiThER SidE Of ThiS iMPUNCTATE STRiP WiTh iRREgULARLY PLACEd STRONg PUNCTURES; LATERAL TO ThESE STRONg PUNCTURES iS AN iLL-dEfiNEd iMPUNCTATE STRiPE; LATERAL fLAT OR dEPRESSEd AREA fiLLEd WiTh STRONg PUNCTURES. DiSC iMPUNCTATE NEAR ANTERiOR ANd POSTERiOR bORdERS. LATERAL PRONOTAL MARgiN bROAdER iN MiddLE, ANTERiORLY NEARLY AS bROAd AS POSTERiOR; LATERAL MARgiN WEAKLY SCALLOPEd. SCUTELLUM NEARLY AS bROAd AS LONg; POSTERiOR MARgiN Of SCUTELLUM bROAdLY ROUNdEd; NEARLY fLAT ON TOP, iMPUNCTATE TO MiNUTELY PUNCTATE.

ELYTRON WiThOUT POST bASAL dEPRESSiON. ELYTRAL APEX CONVEX, APiCAL ANgLE fORMS ACUTE dENTiCLE. ELYTRA ANTERiORLY WiTh SiX dORSAL ANd ThREE LATERAL ROWS Of PUNCTURES; A LiTTLE bEhiNd MiddLE, AN AddiTiONAL ROW ARiSES bETWEEN SiXTh ANd SEVENTh ROWS. FifTh ANd SiXTh ROWS MERgE ANd TERMiNATE NEAR diSTAL ¼ Of ELYTRA.

HYPOMERON RUgOSELY PUNCTATE WiTh diSTANTLY PLACEd fiNE SETAE LATERALLY; PUNCTURES ON hYPOMERON STRONgER POSTERiORLY ThAN ANTERiORLY. PROSTERNUM WiTh SMALL WidELY PLACEd PUNCTURES. PROSTERNAL iNTERCOXAL PROCESS ShiNY, WiThOUT STRONg PUNCTURES, NEARLY fLAT OR WiTh ShALLOW dEPRESSiONS, POSTERiOR MARgiN bROAdLY CONVEX. MESOSTERNUM SMOOTh ANd ShiNY, WiThOUT STRONg PUNCTURES, POSTERiORLY NARROWEd, APEX CONVEX, ShALLOWLY dEPRESSEd. MESEPiSTERNUM ANd MESEPiMERON COARSELY gRANULATE WiTh LARgE ShALLOW PUNCTURES. METASTERNUM SMOOTh ANd ShiNY, EXCEPT COARSE PUNCTURES LATERALLY.

subSubSection.paragraph: AEdEAgUS gENTLY CURVEd iN LATERAL ViEW, ACUTELY NARROWEd TOWARdS APEX ( Fig. 19 ). BASAL PiECE hARdLY SCLEROTizEd. VENTRAL SURfACE gENTLY CONVEX ; iN VENTRAL ViEW, AEdEAgUS bROAdENEd TOWARdS APEX ; APiCAL MARgiN bROAdLY ROUNdEd, MEdiALLY PROdUCEd iNTO AN ObTUSE, ShORT dENTiCLE ( Fig. 21 ). DiSTAL OPENiNg bROAdER ThAN LONg, COVEREd WiTh TWO LAMiNAE ( Fig. 20 ).

n. sp.

Endophallic sclerites of ‘cotype’ through the median lobe of aedeagus.

subSubSection.paragraph: ThREE ENdOPhALLiC SCLERiTES – PROXiMAL dORSAL, MEdiAN ANd diSTAL dORSO-VENTRAL – WELL dEVELOPEd, fORM A COMPLEX NEAR MiddLE Of MEdiAN LObE ( FigS 22 , 24–25, 27–28 ); AddiTiONALLY, A PAiR Of LATERAL LONgiTUdiNAL SCLERiTES PRESENT TOWARdS APEX Of AEdEAgUS ( FigS 24, 25 ). IN VENTRAL ViEW, PROXiMAL dORSAL SCLERiTE LONgER ThAN WidE; MEdiAN SCLERiTE A LiTTLE WidER ThAN LONg; diSTAL dORSO-VENTRAL SCLERiTE WiTh ACUTELY POiNTEd POSTERiOR ENd ( Fig. 25 ).

Etymology. ThiS SPECiES iS NAMEd AfTER ThE
jarawa
AbORigiNAL PEOPLE Of ThE ANdAMAN ISLANdS ( MUKERJEE 2003 ). ThE NAME iS A NOUN iN APPOSiTiON.

subSubSection.paragraph:
MAP 1. Distribution of
Wallacea jarawa
n. sp.
on the Andaman & Nicobar Islands Distribution. INdiA (ANdAMAN & NiCObAR ISLANdS ) (MAP 1).

Remarks.
Wallacea jarawa
n. sp.
CAN bE SEPARATEd fROM ThE OThER CONgENERiC SPECiES bY ThE UNiqUE STRUCTURE Of ThE ENdOPhALLiC SCLERiTES, ESPECiALLY ThE diSTAL dORSO-VENTRAL SCLERiTE WiTh iTS ACUTELY POiNTEd POSTERiOR ENd iN VENTRAL ViEW ( Fig. 24, 25 ).
Wallacea dactyliferae
SUPERfiCiALLY RESEMbLES
W. jarawa
n. sp.
iN bEiNg SiMiLAR iN SizE ANd COLOR PATTERN , ESPECiALLY bY ThE LATERAL bLACK bANd ThAT COVERS ThE ELYTRAL APEX . HOWEVER, bOTh CAN bE SEPARATEd bASEd ON ThE STRUCTURE Of ThE ENdOPhALLiC SCLERiTES. IN
W. dactyliferae
, ThE MEdiAN SCLERiTE iS hORSE-ShOE ShAPEd iN VENTRAL ViEW ( FigS 23 , 26 ), WhiLE ThE SAME iS POLYgONAL iN
W. jarawa
n. sp.
( Fig. 25 ). IdENTiTY Of
W. dactyliferae
WAS ASCERTAiNEd bY STUdYiNg ThE ENdOPhALLiC SCLERiTES Of A ‘COTYPE’ fROM VANiAMbAdY (= VAMAMbAdY iN MAULiK 1919 ) iN TAMiL NAdU , SOUThERN INdiA ( Fig. 23 ). PRESENCE Of A MEdiAN dORSAL bANd ON EACh ELYTRON iN AddiTiON TO ThE LATERAL bANd, diSTiNgUiShES
W. limbata
fROM bOTh
W. jarawa
n. sp.
ANd
W. dactyliferae
(iN
W. dactyliferae
ANd
W. jarawa
n. sp.
, ONLY ThE LATERAL bANd iS PRESENT).
Wallacea apicalis ,
REPORTEd ON COCONUT fROM SUMATRA, CAN bE diffERENTiATEd fROM
W. jarawa
n. sp.
bY ThE ELYTRA bLACK iN diSTAL hALf.

Host plants. BESidES COCONUT PALM (
Cocos nucifera
L.), TWO ANd fiVE AdULTS EACh WERE COLLECTEd ON PALMYRA PALM ,
Borassus flabellifer
L. ANd AN UNidENTifiEd RATTAN CANE (?
Calamus
SP.), RESPECTiVELY (ALL ARECACEAE ), iN ThE SOUTh ANdAMAN ISLANd .

Biology. PRAThAPAN & ShAMEEM (2015) PROVidEd PRELiMiNARY iNfORMATiON ON ThE biOLOgY ANd NATURE Of dAMAgE Of
Wallacea jarawa
n. sp.
ON COCONUT PALM ( FigS 1–5 ).
